original_solution_mapping.L1: Clare bought half of 18 pencils which is 18/2 = <<18/2=9>>9 pencils
original_solution_mapping.L3: Jeanine gave out 6 pencils so he has 18-6 = <<18-6=12>>12 pencils left

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3622.
    Returns: the number of more pencils Jeanine has than Clare.
    """
    # L1
    jeanine_initial_pencils = 18 # 18 pencils
    clare_divisor = 2 # half as many pencils
    clare_pencils = jeanine_initial_pencils / clare_divisor

    # L2
    given_fraction = Fraction(1, 3) # one third of his pencils
    pencils_given_to_abby = given_fraction * jeanine_initial_pencils

    # L3
    jeanine_pencils_left = jeanine_initial_pencils - pencils_given_to_abby

    # L4
    difference_pencils = jeanine_pencils_left - clare_pencils

    # FA
    answer = difference_pencils
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Clare bought half of {jeanine_initial_pencils} pencils which is {jeanine_initial_pencils}/{clare_divisor} = <<{jeanine_initial_pencils}/{clare_divisor}={clare_pencils}>>{clare_pencils} pencils

Jeanine gave out {pencils_given_to_abby} pencils so he has {jeanine_initial_pencils}-{pencils_given_to_abby} = <<{jeanine_initial_pencils}-{pencils_given_to_abby}={jeanine_pencils_left}>>{jeanine_pencils_left} pencils left

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Clare bought half of 18 pencils which is 18/2 = <<18/2=9>>9 pencils
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Jeanine gave out 2 pencils so he has 18-2 = <<18-2=16>>16 pencils left

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'clare_divisor' (value: 2) was used instead of 'pencils_given_to_abby' (value: 6).
